item.description:
New Hampshire Art Association 62nd Currier Exhibition (On display until March 6th)

Following the Orchid show in Nashua earlier in the morning, consider heading just a tad north to revisit the Currier Museum and see some of our very own members' work on display.

This winter the Currier hosts the New Hampshire Art Association's sixty-second juried exhibition at the museum, continuing its commitment to artists working in communities throughout greater New Hampshire. Association members are accomplished regional artists as well as talented emerging artists, and submissions for this jury are open to all media, including painting, drawing, photography and sculpture. Jen Mergel, Beal Family Senior Curator of Contemporary Art at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston and Dina Deitsch, Associate Curator of Contemporary Art at deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum, Lincoln, MA will jury this year's submissions.

Mining Artistic Possibilities: Artists Interpret Their Surroundings

Work from the Currier’s collection by accomplished artists with ties to the New Hampshire Art Association will accompany the juried show. Works on view will highlight the diverse ways artists in a community see and experience their surroundings, mining the aesthetic, symbolic and narrative possibilities of the places, landscapes and sites they encounter. Works by James Aponovich, Bill Finney, Carl A. Hyatt and Hope Zanes, amongst others, will be included.

http://www.currier.or... 

Ken suggested this timely event. Great idea, Ken, and if you think so as well, join our group for a tour of the exhibit and post-tour Café Klatsch at the Currier.

Admissions prices: 
FREE (if you come betwen 10AM-Noon), otherwise: 
$10.00 Adults 
$9.00 Seniors (65+) 
$8.00 Students 
Under 18 and Members: free

Memberships are only $45 for adults, $65 for couples.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the front entrance and look for a bunch of photo geeks.
item.why: Some of our members are on display and the Currier is a great museum!
item.name: The Currier Museum: Annual NHAA Exhibit
